      • joinConversation

        public void joinConversation(Conversation.WrappedId id)
        Depending on conversation type:
        • Sends a join_channel request to server or ...
        • creates a new dialogue and informs session listeners. If attributes of dialogue peer are not known, load them first.
        Parameters:
        id -

      • removeDialogue

        public void removeDialogue(java.lang.String id)
        Removes dialogue and calls session listeners. This method is required because dialogues are stateless. User doesn't establish a dialogue with another user - they just send a message. Use this for closing a dialogue which has no sent or received messages.
        Parameters:
        id -

      • getConversations

        public java.util.List<Conversation> getConversations()
        Returns an immutable list that contains channels and dialogues in sorted order.

        Note: Currently this method creates a new list on every method call and it is highly discouraged to call this multiple times inside a loop.

        Returns:
        Sorted conversations
